name: Personal Data
description: Any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person ('data subject'). An identifiable natural person is one who can be identified, directly or indirectly, in particular by reference to an identifier such as a name, an identification number, location data, an online identifier or to one or more factors specific to the physical, physiological, genetic, mental, economic, cultural or social identity of that natural person.

name: Sensitive Personal Data
description: Special categories of personal data that reveal racial or ethnic origin, political opinions, religious or philosophical beliefs, trade union membership, genetic data, biometric data for uniquely identifying a person, health data, or data concerning a person's sex life or sexual orientation. These categories require enhanced protection and additional safeguards.

name: Health Data
description: Personal data related to the physical or mental health of a natural person, including the provision of health care services, which reveal information about their health status. This includes medical records, health insurance information, prescriptions, diagnoses, treatment plans, and any data processed for healthcare purposes.

name: Financial Data
description: Personal data related to financial transactions, accounts, assets, credit history, and economic situation. This includes banking information, payment card details, transaction history, credit scores, and any data that reveals financial status or behavior.

name: Location Data
description: Data about the geographic position of an individual or device, whether current, historical, or derived. This includes precise geolocation from GPS, approximate location from cell towers or Wi-Fi, and any data that can reveal movement patterns or physical presence.

name: Biometric Data
description: Personal data resulting from specific technical processing relating to the physical, physiological or behavioral characteristics of a natural person, which allow or confirm the unique identification of that person. This includes facial images, fingerprints, iris scans, voice patterns, and gait analysis.

name: Behavioral Data
description: Data about online and offline behavior patterns, preferences, and characteristics derived from observing or tracking actions. This includes browsing history, purchase patterns, app usage, preferences, and profiling data used for analysis or prediction of behavior.

name: Contact Data
description: Data used for communication and contact purposes, including various forms of contact information that enable reaching or identifying an individual for correspondence or interaction.

name: Identification Data
description: Data used for official identification and verification of identity, including government-issued identifiers and documents that establish or confirm a person's identity. This category is crucial for identity management and verification processes.

name: Communication Data
description: Content and metadata of communications including messages, emails, calls, and other forms of electronic communication. This includes both the content of communications and associated metadata such as timestamps, participants, and routing information.

name: Device Data
description: Technical data about devices used to access services or systems, including device identifiers, characteristics, and metadata. This data can be used to identify devices, track usage, or enable device-specific functionality.

name: Demographic Data
description: Statistical data about populations and groups, including characteristics such as age, gender, education, occupation, and family status. Used for analysis, segmentation, and understanding population characteristics.
